title: McClintic Wildlife Management Area
text:
The Clifton F. McClintic Wildlife Management Area, known locally as "the <a href="Trinitrotoluene">TNT</a> area", is a naturalized area located in <a href="Mason%20County%2C%20West%20Virginia">Mason County</a> about north of <a href="Point%20Pleasant%2C%20West%20Virginia">Point Pleasant, West Virginia</a>. Located on of former <a href="World%20War%20II">wartime</a> industrial land, the WMA is occupied by <a href="arable%20land">farmland</a>, <a href="woodland">woodland</a>s, and <a href="wetlands">wetlands</a> encompassing 31 <a href="ponds">ponds</a>. The area still contains stored explosives.
Hunting and fishing.
Hunting opportunities include <a href="White%20tailed%20deer">deer</a>, <a href="mourning%20dove">mourning dove</a>, <a href="ruffed%20grouse">grouse</a>, <a href="rabbit">rabbit</a>, <a href="raccoon">raccoon</a>, <a href="squirrel">squirrel</a>, <a href="waterfowl">waterfowl</a>, <a href="woodcock">woodcock</a>, and <a href="Wild%20turkey">turkey</a>. Special regulations for deer hunting have been established for the WMA to create a "trophy buck hunting" area. Only bucks with an antler spread of or more may be taken in the WMA.
Trapping opportunities include <a href="American%20beaver">beaver</a>, <a href="mink">mink</a>, <a href="muskrat">muskrat</a>, and <a href="raccoon">raccoon</a>. A special permit from the District Wildlife Biologist is required to run traps on WMA land.
Fishing opportunities abound in the 29 ponds available for fishing and in the nearby <a href="Ohio%20River">Ohio River</a>. Warmwater species fishing opportunities can include <a href="walleye">walleye</a>, <a href="Muskellunge">musky</a>, <a href="Muskellunge%23Subspecies_and_hybrids">tiger musky</a>, <a href="channel%20catfish">channel catfish</a>, <a href="hybrid%20striped%20bass">hybrid striped bass</a>, <a href="sauger">saugeye</a>, <a href="Lepomis">sunfish</a>, <a href="largemouth%20bass">largemouth bass</a>, and <a href="smallmouth%20bass">smallmouth bass</a>.
Rustic camping is available seasonally in the WMA. A shooting range is also available.
Paranormal enthusiasts believe the <a href="Mothman">Mothman</a> makes (or made) its home here.
